alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 16 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of DownEast Maine, including the following counties, Hancock and Washington. * WHEN...Until 130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1245 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Machias, Cherryfield, Jonesport, Steuben, Harrington, Jonesboro, Columbia Falls, Columbia, Millbridge, Centerville, Franklin, Gouldsboro, Addison, Sullivan, Machiasport, Winter Harbor, Beals, Roque Bluffs and Whitneyville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
